summary: Sodium carbonate, also called washing soda or soda ash, is a white, odorless, water-soluble salt with the formula Na2CO3. Historically, it was made from plant ashes, giving it the name "soda ash." Now, it's mostly produced in factories using the Solvay process or by carbonating sodium hydroxide. It creates an alkaline solution when dissolved in water and is used in many household and industrial products.
title: Sodium carbonate
